articles.headline: Video: Bolsonaro, Facing Investigations, Hid at Hungarian Embassy
articles.snippet: Security-camera footage obtained by The Times shows that Brazil’s former president spent two nights at the Hungarian Embassy in an apparent bid for asylum.
articles.abstract: Security-camera footage obtained by The Times shows that Brazil’s former president spent two nights at the Hungarian Embassy in an apparent bid for asylum.
articles.lead_paragraph: On Feb. 8, Brazil’s federal police confiscated former President Jair Bolsonaro’s passport and arrested a pair of his former aides on accusations that they had plotted a coup after Mr. Bolsonaro lost the 2022 presidential election.
articles.byline: By Jack Nicas, Christoph Koettl, Leonardo Coelho and Paulo Motoryn

articles.headline: Vowing the U.S. Will ‘Do Our Job,’ Johnson Searches for a Path on Ukraine
articles.snippet: The Republican speaker, with his job on the line, has privately told people he would make sure the House moves to assist Ukraine, a step that many members of his party oppose.
articles.abstract: The Republican speaker, with his job on the line, has privately told people he would make sure the House moves to assist Ukraine, a step that many members of his party oppose.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Speaker Mike Johnson opened the floor for questions at a closed-door luncheon fund-raiser in New Jersey last month, Jacquie Colgan asked how, in the face of vehement opposition within his own ranks, he planned to handle aid for Ukraine.

articles.headline: NBC News Faces Rebellion Over Hiring of Former Republican Party Chair
articles.snippet: In extraordinary on-air remarks, Mika Brzezinski, Joe Scarborough and Nicolle Wallace questioned their own network’s decision to hire Ronna McDaniel as a political analyst.
articles.abstract: In extraordinary on-air remarks, Mika Brzezinski, Joe Scarborough and Nicolle Wallace questioned their own network’s decision to hire Ronna McDaniel as a political analyst.
articles.lead_paragraph: Leadership at NBC raced to contain an escalating revolt on Monday as some of the country’s best-known television anchors took the extraordinary step of criticizing their network on its own airwaves for hiring Ronna McDaniel, the former chairwoman of the Republican National Committee, as a political analyst.

articles.headline: U.N. Security Council Calls for Immediate Cease-Fire in Gaza as U.S. Abstains
articles.snippet: The U.S. decision not to vote on the resolution drew criticism from Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel, who ordered a delegation to hold back from a planned trip to Washington.
articles.abstract: The U.S. decision not to vote on the resolution drew criticism from Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel, who ordered a delegation to hold back from a planned trip to Washington.
articles.lead_paragraph: The United Nations Security Council on Monday passed a resolution calling for an immediate cease-fire in the Gaza Strip during the remaining weeks of Ramadan, breaking a five-month impasse during which the United States vetoed three calls for a halt to the fighting.
articles.byline: By Farnaz Fassihi, Aaron Boxerman and Thomas Fuller

articles.headline: Trump Isn’t Reaching Out to Haley and Her Voters. Will It Matter?
articles.snippet: Republicans are debating the wisdom of the former president’s decision to bypass any reconciliation with Nikki Haley.
articles.abstract: Republicans are debating the wisdom of the former president’s decision to bypass any reconciliation with Nikki Haley.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Nikki Haley dropped out of the 2024 presidential race in early March, she withheld endorsing Donald J. Trump and extended a pointed invitation for him to court her and the political coalition she constructed. “This is now his time for choosing,” she said then.
articles.byline: By Shane Goldmacher and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: How a New Rule Could Change the Way Advisers Handle Your Retirement Money
articles.snippet: The Labor Department’s latest push for a new fiduciary rule would protect investors’ retirement savings and require financial services providers to change.
articles.abstract: The Labor Department’s latest push for a new fiduciary rule would protect investors’ retirement savings and require financial services providers to change.
articles.lead_paragraph: It seems like an issue everyone can agree on: Financial professionals should be required to handle our retirement money with the utmost care, putting investors’ interests first.

articles.headline: Supreme Court Seems Inclined to Reject Bid to Curtail Abortion Pill Access
articles.snippet: A majority of the justices questioned whether a group of anti-abortion doctors and organizations trying to sharply limit availability of the medication could show they suffered harm.
articles.abstract: A majority of the justices questioned whether a group of anti-abortion doctors and organizations trying to sharply limit availability of the medication could show they suffered harm.
articles.lead_paragraph: A majority of the Supreme Court appeared deeply skeptical on Tuesday of efforts to severely curtail access to a widely used abortion pill, questioning whether a group of anti-abortion doctors and organizations had a right to challenge the Food and Drug Administration’s approval of the medication.

articles.headline: Trump’s Media Company Worth Nearly $8 Billion on First Trading Day
articles.snippet: Trump Media & Technology Group, fresh from a merger with a cash-rich shell company, started trading on the Nasdaq, adding billions of dollars to the former president’s wealth.
articles.abstract: Trump Media & Technology Group, fresh from a merger with a cash-rich shell company, started trading on the Nasdaq, adding billions of dollars to the former president’s wealth.
articles.lead_paragraph: Former President Donald J. Trump’s social media company jumped on its first day of trading on the Nasdaq on Tuesday, giving the company an estimated market value of close to $8 billion, larger than established corporations like Mattel, Alaska Airlines and Western Union.
articles.byline: By Matthew Goldstein and Joe Rennison

articles.headline: The U.S. Investors Caught in the Scrum Over TikTok
articles.snippet: Major U.S. investment firms such as General Atlantic, Susquehanna and Sequoia Capital own stakes in ByteDance, the parent of TikTok. Their investments are increasingly under fire.
articles.abstract: Major U.S. investment firms such as General Atlantic, Susquehanna and Sequoia Capital own stakes in ByteDance, the parent of TikTok. Their investments are increasingly under fire.
articles.lead_paragraph: For years, the U.S. investors who backed ByteDance, the Chinese internet company that owns TikTok, have wrestled with the complexities of owning a piece of a geopolitically fraught social media app.

articles.headline: Biden’s TikTok Challenge: Reach Gen Z, Without Drawing Its Wrath
articles.snippet: For his campaign, navigating the platform has meant encountering over and over some of the thorniest issues plaguing President Biden’s re-election bid.
articles.abstract: For his campaign, navigating the platform has meant encountering over and over some of the thorniest issues plaguing President Biden’s re-election bid.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Biden’s campaign is working to reach across the generation gap to the tens of millions of predominantly younger voters on TikTok, where the challenges are daunting and the rewards difficult to track.
